name: Martial
description: Your start with 1 Focus Point and your FP increases as shown in the Hunter Class Table. You also known Manuevers as shown in the table.

name: Hunting Weapon Proficiency
description: You are Proficient with Daggers and Spears.

name: Ranged Weapon Proficiency
description: You are Proficient with Bows, Crossbows, and Muskets.

name: Hunter's Focus
description: You regain half of your FP when:\\n- You roll a Perception checks and successfully spot a hidden creature.\\n- Once per round, when you Hit the target of your Hunter's Mark with an Attack.\\n- The target of your Hunter's Mark is reduced to 0 HP or dies.

name: Hunter's Mark
description: You can spend 1 AP and 1 FP to focus on and mark a creature as the target of your Hunter's Mark. Alternatively, you can mark a creature by studying its tracks for at least 1 minute. While a creature is marked, you gain the following benefits:\\n- You have ADV on Perception and Survival Checks to find the target.\\n- The first weapon attack you make against your targets has ADV and ignores Physical Damage Reduction.\\n- When you score a Heavy or Critical Hit against your target you automatically grant a d8 Help Die to the next Attack made against the target before the start of your next turn.\\n \\nYou lose your mark if you complete a Long Rest, fall Unconscious, or use this feature again to mark another creature.

name: Favored Terrain
description: Your experience with specific Terrains has led you to have some useful skills. Choose 2 types of Favored Terrain to gain their benefits:\\n- Coast: You can hold your breath twice as long as normal and have ADV on Perception Checks while underwater.\\n-
